metadata.authority_name: Bank for International Settlements — Basel Committee on Banking Supervision

content.verbatim_text: The Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) capital ratio is the ratio of a bank's core equity capital to its total risk-weighted assets (RWAs). CET1 capital consists of: common shares, retained earnings, other comprehensive income, qualifying minority interests, and regulatory adjustments. The minimum CET1 ratio is 4.5%, with a capital conservation buffer of 2.5%, bringing the effective minimum to 7%.
content.title: Common Equity Tier 1 Capital Ratio

structured_data.relevance_to_odgs: Defines the denominator for financial health metrics — directly governs how ODGS financial metrics calculate capital adequacy
